translations.name: Angal Heneng mbuk Ngaoran Angal Bib Hobau Sao ngo wi o
Sampela hap Buk Baibel long tokples Burum Mindik long Niugini
Yuna Old and New Testament Revision
The New Testament in Enga
translations.description: The New Testament in the Enga language of Papua New Guinea The first contact the Enga people had with the outside world was in 1934 when gold prospectors made an expedition into Enga territory. Fifteen years later, in 1948, the first missionaries arrived. A translation of Mark and 1 Timothy was published in the Enga language in 1965, followed by the complete New Testament using a mixture of dialects in 1988. A New Testament was also completed in the Sau dialect of Enga in 1979. The copyright to the 1988 edition belongs to The Bible Society of Papua New Guinea.
